WASHINGTON  A Florida computer engineering professor and seven other men were charged Thursday with overseeing and financing the Palestinian Islamic Jihad terrorist group which has been blamed for killing more than  people in Israel and adjacent territories PERIOD
The University of South Florida professor 45yearold Sami Amin AlArian and three other U.S PERIOD residents were arrested after the 50count indictment was returned by a federal grand jury in Tampa Fla PERIOD The indictment describes AlArian as the Islamic Jihads U.S PERIOD leader head of a terrorist cell in Tampa and secretary of the groups worldwide council PERIOD
Attorney General John Ashcroft said the indictment sends a message We will hunt down the suppliers of terrorist money we will shut down their sources and we will ensure that both terrorists and their financiers meet the same swift certain justice of the United States of America. shortly after his arrest in Tampa AlArian told reporters Its all about politics. on forced leave from the university he has publicly rejected the idea that he has ties to terrorism PERIOD
His attorney Nicholas Matassini said after a preliminary court hearing Hes a political prisoner right now as we speak. the attorney denounced the indictment as a work of fiction. the indictment accuses the eight men of operating a criminal racketeering enterprise since  supporting Palestinian Islamic Jihad and with conspiracy to kill and maim people abroad conspiracy to provide material support to the group extortion visa fraud perjury and other charges PERIOD Each defendant could face life in prison if convicted PERIOD
AlArian and two others were arrested in Tampa and a fourth man was arrested in Chicago PERIOD The other four are leaders of the group who live abroad and are being sought Ashcroft said PERIOD
Palestinian Islamic Jihad was founded in the late 1970s and its roots go back to the Muslim Brotherhood in Egypt that also spawned the Hamas terrorist group PERIOD Its goals according to the indictment are to destroy Israel and end Western influence in the Middle East PERIOD
The groups alleged killings have included suicide bombings car bombings and driveby shootings including a June   suicide attack in Haifa Israel that killed  and injured  PERIOD
Among the people whose deaths are blamed on the organization are two U.S PERIOD citizens Alisa Flatow  and Shoshana BenYishai  PERIOD
Alisa Flatow then a junior at Brandeis University died in a  bus bombing in the Gaza Strip PERIOD 
Her father Stephen Flatow of West Orange N.J. said Thursday This demonstrates the old saw about the wheels of justice  they grind slow but they grind exceedingly fine. the indictment describes numerous intercepted telephone calls and faxes in which those charged are said to have discussed Islamic Jihad bombings and other attacks financial problems and whether to ally more closely with terror groups Hezbollah and Hamas PERIOD There is no mention of alQaida PERIOD
The men frequently talk in apparent code substituting words like magazine and shirt for thousands of dollars they were allegedly funneling to Islamic Jihad PERIOD
To date Ashcroft said the Justice Department has investigated  terrorist financing or support organizations winning  convictions and freezing  million in assets of  organizations PERIOD
The Islamic Jihad fundraising and other alleged activities were centered on two organizations in Tampa the Islamic Committee for Palestine  originally called Islamic Concern Project Inc PERIOD  and the World and Islamic Studies Enterprise or WISE according to the indictment PERIOD Most of those charged also had some connection to the University of South Florida at one time or another PERIOD
Besides AlArian those arrested were
Sameeh Hammoudeh  born in the West Bank now a resident of Temple Terrace Fla PERIOD He is an instructor at the University of South Florida and administrator at the Islamic Academy of Florida PERIOD
Hatim Naji Fariz  born in Puerto Rico and now living in Spring Hill Fla PERIOD He is a manager at a medical clinic PERIOD
Ghassan Zayed Ballut  a West Bank native now living in Tinley Park Ill. and owner of a small business PERIOD
Those living abroad were
Ramadan Abdullah Shallah  a Gaza Strip native and now resident of Damascus Syria PERIOD He is described as the worldwide leader of Palestinian Islamic Jihad a former instructor at the University of South Florida and former executive director of the World Islam and Studies Enterprise PERIOD
Bashir Musa Mohammed Nafi  originally from Egypt and now living in Oxfordshire England PERIOD The indictment calls him the United Kingdom leader of the group he also was formerly associated with WISE PERIOD
Mohammed Tasir Hassan AlKhatib  originally from the Gaza Strip and now living in Beirut PERIOD He is described as treasurer of the organization and formerly of the Islamic Committee for Palestine in Tampa PERIOD
Abd AL Aziz Awda  born in Israel and now imam of the Al Qassam Mosque in Gaza Strip PERIOD The indictment calls him the founder and spiritual leader of the group PERIOD
